Description: Lower body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior streakily glazed (fired brown); exterior reserved with traces of two narrow brown lines.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0351) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4650 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
